name: openbrowser
description: CodeAgent MCP server -- execute Python code with browser automation functions in a persistent namespace
long_description:
OpenBrowser CodeAgent exposes a single execute_code tool that runs Python code in a persistent namespace with browser automation functions. Write multi-step workflows in Python with full access to navigate, click, type, evaluate JS, and more.

### Key Features:
- **Code Execution**: Write Python code with async browser functions (await navigate, click, evaluate, etc.)
- **Persistent Namespace**: Variables and state persist between execute_code calls
- **Browser Automation**: Full browser control via CodeAgent functions
- **JavaScript Evaluation**: Run JS in page context via evaluate()
- **Data Libraries**: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, BeautifulSoup available
- **Standard Libraries**: json, csv, re, datetime, requests, asyncio, Path

### Use Cases:
- Web scraping with Python data processing
- Automated testing with assertions
- Research and information gathering
- Form filling and multi-step workflows
- DOM extraction via evaluate() + Python post-processing

tools.name: execute_code
tools.description: Execute Python code in a persistent namespace with browser automation functions (navigate, click, evaluate, etc.). All functions are async -- use await.

prompts.name: scrape_data
prompts.description: Extract structured data from a website
prompts.text: Use execute_code to write Python that navigates to {url}, extracts data using evaluate() for JS DOM queries or Python string processing, and prints structured results.

prompts.name: fill_form
prompts.description: Fill out and submit a web form
prompts.text: Use execute_code to navigate to {url}, get browser state to find form fields, then use input_text() and click() to fill and submit the form with: {field_data}.

prompts.name: research_topic
prompts.description: Research a topic across multiple websites
prompts.text: Use execute_code to navigate to multiple sites, extract content using evaluate() or page text, and aggregate findings about {topic} using Python data structures.

workspace_directory.title: Workspace Directory

headless.title: Headless Mode
headless.description: Run browser without GUI (faster but no visual feedback). Set to false to see the browser in action

stealth.title: Stealth Mode
stealth.description: Use stealth mode to avoid detection by anti-bot systems

user_data_dir.title: User Data Directory
user_data_dir.description: Chrome profile directory for persistent sessions (cookies, localStorage, etc)

disable_security.title: Disable Security

deterministic_rendering.title: Deterministic Rendering

viewport_expansion.title: Viewport Expansion

sensitive_data_masking.title: Sensitive Data Masking
sensitive_data_masking.description: Mask sensitive data (passwords, credit cards) in screenshots and logs
